newsitem.title: FRANCE: Chinese minister hails positive Algerian development.
newsitem.headline: Chinese minister hails positive Algerian development.

text.p: China's Foreign Affairs Minister Qian Qichen, in a stopover in Algiers, on Sunday hailed what he called "positive development" in violent Algeria, the Algerian official news agency APS reported.
"Qian Qichen declared he was very happy at the positive development of the situation in Algeria," APS quoted the Chinese minister as saying.
He held talks with his Algerian counterpart Ahmed Attaf and the two men pledged to strengthen ties between their countries.
About 60,000 people have died in Algeria's violence since early 1992 when the authorities cancelled a general election in which Islamists had taken a commanding lead.
Algeria's President Liamine Zeroual visited China last October, the first such visit by an Algerian president in the past two decades.
"The president's visit to China opened more prospects for cooperation," Attaf said.
